subject: Public Speaking
title: The Straw Man and How to Spot It
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Straw Man and How to Spot It.

hook.text: You argue for better school lunches. Your opponent says: They want to spend millions on gourmet meals for kids!

buildup.text: A straw man misrepresents your argument, then attacks the distorted version. It's easier to defeat a dummy than reality.

discovery.text: The technique works because audiences don't notice the substitution. The rebuttal sounds convincing against the fake.

twist.text: Politicians and pundits use straw men constantly. Once you learn to spot them, you'll see them in every debate.

climax.text: The defense is simple: restate your actual argument clearly. Force the opponent to engage with what you really said.

punchline.text: They're not arguing with you. They're arguing with your shadow.

quiz.question: What is a straw man argument?
options: Misrepresenting someone's position then attacking the distortion
